alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin; Perry; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 4:42AM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River At Clifton affecting Wayne, Perry, Hardin and Decatur Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Clifton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River At Clifton. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 370.0 feet, In Decatur County, the boat launch and parking lot areas of Riverstone Marina are flooded. In Wayne County, water begins to flood portions of Beechview Drive and the Beech Lake Campground on Beech Lake Road. In Perry County, access roads in the Peters Landing area including Peters Landing Road begin to flood. In Hardin County, in the Cobb Farm area of Nance Bend and low lying portions of Senator Cobb Road and Colonel James Hardin Drive begin to flood and access may be limited. At 373.0 feet, In Decatur county, water inundates the heli-pad in the Rivers Edge Landing subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5 AM Saturday the river is estimated to be around 370 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 372.4 feet by early Tuesday morning. It will then fall but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 900 AM CST.
